name: 3x2k / 6min rest
description: High-intensity interval workout consisting of structured 6-minute work periods with appropriate rest. Focus on maintaining consistent splits throughout all work intervals, with each interval within 2 splits of the others. Keep technique solid even as fatigue builds, focusing on strong leg drive and clean finishes.
technique_focus: Power application without rushing the slide
coaching_points: Drive hard with legs while maintaining proper sequence
Focus on quick catches without lunging or overreaching
Accelerate through the finish with complete back swing
Keep recovery controlled and deliberate even at higher rates
pacing_guidance:
Target -2 to +5 seconds from 2k pace for intervals. Maintain consistency across intervals with minimal split variance (1-2 seconds).

Effort level: Very challenging, 8-9/10 perceived effort

name: 30' Steady UT1 - Straight
description: 30 minutes continuous steady rowing at UT1. Focus on breathing and consistent rhythm for aerobic development.
coaching_points: Use strong legs and maintain posture
Avoid overreaching at catch
Keep recovery long and relaxed
pacing_guidance: Target UT1 HR/easy threshold gap. Pace ~2:10/500m (approx splits around 1:05 per 250). Maintain stroke rate 20-22 SPM.

name: 20' Steady UT2 - Straight
description: 20 minutes continuous steady state at UT2 intensity on the erg. Keep a consistent stroke rate and relaxed technique throughout.
coaching_points: Keep long, controlled strokes
Relax shoulders and wrists
Steady strong leg drive and smooth finish
pacing_guidance: Target UT2 HR zone (easy conversational pace). Hold approx 2:20/500m pace (≈140s per 500). Maintain consistent split +/- 2s.

name: 50' Steady UT2 - 10' Blocks with Drill Finish
description: 50 minutes composed of 5 x 10' steady blocks; at the end of each block perform 20 strokes of focus drill before continuing.
coaching_points: Use 20-stroke drill to reset technique
Avoid power spikes during transition back to steady
Stay mindful of breath
pacing_guidance: Maintain UT2 ~2:20/500 across each block. Drill strokes at reduced SR to re-focus technique.

name: 40' Steady UT1 - Alternating Splits
description: 40 minutes steady at UT1 with alternating 10-minute splits: odd 10' at lower UT1, even 10' slightly higher UT1 to practice holding tempo.
coaching_points: Keep finish clean when intensity rises
Shorten catch to maintain rhythm when fatigued
Use breathing to control effort
pacing_guidance: Alternate between ~2:12/500 and ~2:08/500 every 10 minutes. HR should be high-aerobic but not anaerobic.

name: 20' Steady UT2 - Square Blade Drill
description: 20 minutes steady with 4 x 4min blocks of square-blade emphasis (on the erg: lighter grip and pretend square blade) to develop connection.
coaching_points: Keep wrists flat and avoid over-rotating
Emphasize smooth acceleration through drive
Stay relaxed and breathe consistently
pacing_guidance: UT2 pace ~2:20/500. Lower SR by 1-2 SPM on drill segments to focus on feel.

name: 80' Steady UT2 - Endurance Focus
description: 80 minutes continuous steady state concentrating on aerobic base, efficient breathing, and pacing consistency.
coaching_points: Maintain low SR (16-18) early and increase only if technique allows
Hydration plan important for long sessions
Monitor stroke length to avoid shortening under fatigue
pacing_guidance: Hold UT2 pace ~2:20/500. Use perceived effort and HR as main guides; adjust slightly to keep aerobic.

name: Threshold Tempo Shuffle
description: Continuous 28' AT effort with planned small tempo changes every 7 minutes (30s a bit higher, then return). Teaches control of small surges at threshold and faster recovery back to steady AT.
coaching_points: Plan the mini surges mentally before starting so they're executed controlled and with purpose.
Return immediately to AT pace; the goal is control rather than all-out efforts.
Focus on economy: surges should feel powerful but not wasteful.
Monitor breathing and posture especially after surges to avoid technique drift.
pacing_guidance: 28' continuous at AT with 30s controlled increases every 7'. Base pace is AT (10–18s slower than 2k pace); surges are 5–8s quicker than AT. Try to maintain stroke rate 22–24 and keep surges smooth and repeatable.

name: 60' Steady UT1 - Cruise Endurance
description: 60 minutes at higher aerobic (UT1) intensity. Emphasize sustained power and economy of movement.
coaching_points: Keep stroke length consistent
Avoid over-driving with upper body
Practice steady inhalation/exhalation rhythm
pacing_guidance: Hold UT1 ~2:10/500. Keep stroke rate 20-22 SPM. Monitor HR to stay aerobic but high-end.

name: 45' Steady UT2 - Legs Only Emphasis
description: 45 minutes steady with 5 x 3min legs-only (single leg drive) spaced through the session to emphasize leg power and sequencing.
coaching_points: On legs-only, isolate legs and hold upper body steady
Return to full strokes focusing on transferring leg power into handle speed
Maintain relaxed shoulders
pacing_guidance: Hold UT2 pace ~2:20/500 for full strokes. During legs-only keep effort similar but lower SR; recover afterwards to maintain HR in UT2.

name: 35' Steady UT1 - Technique Intervals
description: 35 minutes continuous at UT1 with micro-drills every 7 minutes: 30s arms-only, 30s legs-only, then resume full strokes.
coaching_points: Use arms/legs-only to re-calibrate sequence
Return to full strokes with focus on timing
Keep SR consistent during drills
pacing_guidance: Target UT1 pace ~2:10/500. During drills, reduce power but keep rhythm. HR should remain aerobic.

name: 25' Steady UT2 - SR Changes
description: 25 minutes continuous: every 5 minutes change stroke rate (18, 20, 16, 22, 18) while maintaining power and technique.
coaching_points: On lower SR focus on longer drive
On higher SR keep quick recovery but not rushed catch
Monitor average split across changes
pacing_guidance: Maintain UT2 power output; rowing at different SRs should yield same perceived effort. Keep HR steady in UT2 band.

name: 90' Endurance Steady UT2 - Long Slow Distance
description: 90 minutes continuous steady state for maximal aerobic time and fatigue resistance. Focus on technique and economical movement.
coaching_points: Fuel and hydrate during session
Break into mini-goals (e.g., 15min blocks)
Focus on relaxed shoulders and consistent catch timing
pacing_guidance: Sustain UT2 ~2:20/500. Keep SR low (16-18 SPM early, can go to 18-20 later). Monitor HR to remain aerobic.

name: 2x(5x1min)/6min rest between sets
description: High-intensity interval workout consisting of structured 1-minute work periods with appropriate rest. Focus on maintaining consistent splits throughout all work intervals, with each interval within 2 splits of the others. Keep technique solid even as fatigue builds, focusing on strong leg drive and clean finishes.
technique_focus: Strong leg drive with good sequencing
coaching_points: Drive hard with legs while maintaining proper sequence
Focus on quick catches without lunging or overreaching
Accelerate through the finish with complete back swing
Keep recovery controlled and deliberate even at higher rates
pacing_guidance:
Target -2 to -10 seconds faster than 2k pace for work intervals. Focus on maintaining consistent effort across all intervals, with the goal of each interval being within 2 splits of each other.

Effort level: Maximum sustainable effort, 9-10/10 perceived effort

name: 3x20min / 5min rest
description: Interval-based endurance workout with structured 20-minute segments. Maintain consistent pacing through each work interval, focusing on efficient technique and controlled breathing. Use the rest periods to recover while maintaining good posture and mental focus for the next interval.
technique_focus: Clean blade work with minimal splash
Relaxed recovery at an appropriate pace
Maintaining consistent body angles at the catch
coaching_points: Focus on the sequence: connection first, then power application, then finish
Keep shoulders relaxed and low throughout the recovery
Think of your power coming from pushing rather than pulling
Establish rhythm first, then layer in technical focus points one at a time
pacing_guidance:
Target +20 to +30 seconds from 2k pace. Focus on sustainable rhythm and consistent pacing throughout each interval.

Effort level: Conversational, 5-6/10 perceived effort

name: Two by Ten with Build
description: 2 × 10 minutes at AT with 4 minutes easy between. Each 10' block includes a controlled build: first 5' at AT minus a small % then settle into full AT for the second 5'. Teaches pacing and finishing strength.
coaching_points: Start each 10' slightly conservative and build into AT during minutes 4–6.
Use the rest to reset breathing and focus on efficient leg drive.
The second half of each 10' should emphasize sustaining the higher pace with clean technique.
pacing_guidance: Begin the first half of each block slightly below AT and then move to true AT—this helps practice controlled pacing and finishing. Maintain stroke quality as you increase power.

name: Heart Rate Cap Steady State
description: Continuous steady-state rowing focusing on consistent pace, efficient technique, and aerobic development. Maintain a sustainable effort level where form remains intact throughout. Focus on breathing rhythm, relaxed recovery, and consistent power application through the drive.
technique_focus: Clean blade work with minimal splash
Relaxed recovery at an appropriate pace
Maintaining consistent body angles at the catch
coaching_points: Focus on the sequence: connection first, then power application, then finish
Keep shoulders relaxed and low throughout the recovery
Think of your power coming from pushing rather than pulling
Establish rhythm first, then layer in technical focus points one at a time
pacing_guidance:
Target approximately +20 to +30 seconds from 2k pace. Maintain consistent splits throughout with a focus on sustainable technique and efficiency. In terms of power, aim for 55-65% of 2k watts.

Effort level: Conversational, 5-6/10 perceived effort

name: 4x4min / 3min rest (2min at 24spm, 2min at 26spm)
description: Interval-based endurance workout with structured 4-minute segments. Maintain consistent pacing through each work interval, focusing on efficient technique and controlled breathing. Use the rest periods to recover while maintaining good posture and mental focus for the next interval.
coaching_points: Focus on maintaining consistent power through the entire drive
Keep breathing pattern regular: exhale on the drive, inhale on recovery
Think about 'hanging' off the handle rather than pulling with arms
Maintain length at the catch even as fatigue builds
pacing_guidance:
Target +5 to +10 seconds from 2k pace. Focus on sustainable rhythm and consistent pacing throughout each interval.

Effort level: Hard but controlled, 7-8/10 perceived effort

name: 4x5min / 3min rest
description: Interval-based endurance workout with structured 5-minute segments. Maintain consistent pacing through each work interval, focusing on efficient technique and controlled breathing. Use the rest periods to recover while maintaining good posture and mental focus for the next interval.
coaching_points: Focus on maintaining consistent power through the entire drive
Keep breathing pattern regular: exhale on the drive, inhale on recovery
Think about 'hanging' off the handle rather than pulling with arms
Maintain length at the catch even as fatigue builds
pacing_guidance:
Target +5 to +10 seconds from 2k pace. Focus on sustainable rhythm and consistent pacing throughout each interval.

Effort level: Hard but controlled, 7-8/10 perceived effort

name: 45' Steady UT1 - Brisk Endurance
description: 45 minutes continuous UT1 to improve high-end aerobic capacity with emphasis on sustainable rhythm and technique.
coaching_points: Stay relaxed in upper body as intensity remains high
Make small technique checks every 10 minutes
Keep breathing steady and deep
pacing_guidance: Maintain UT1 pace ~2:10/500 at SR 20-22. Use perceived exertion and HR to ensure aerobic work.

name: 35' Steady UT2 - Controlled Push at 25'
description: 35 minutes continuous: maintain UT2 for 25'; final 10' include a controlled push to upper UT2 focusing on sustained technique.
coaching_points: Push should be controlled increase, not a sprint
Keep shoulders relaxed and avoid over-correcting
Focus on leg drive for the added power
pacing_guidance: 0-25' UT2 ~2:20/500; final 10' upper UT2 ~2:12/500. Keep SR steady and avoid anaerobic efforts.

name: 25' Steady UT2 - Cruise with 5 Stroke Builds
description: 25 minutes steady with 6 x 5-stroke mini-builds scattered to practice short accelerations while staying aerobic.
coaching_points: Keep builds controlled and short
Focus on clean catches on acceleration strokes
Recover rapidly afterwards
pacing_guidance: Base UT2 pace ~2:20/500. Mini-builds increase power for 5 strokes but return to UT2 level immediately after.

name: 2x20 Sustained Threshold
description: Two long AT repeats to develop ability to produce high sustainable power for extended durations. After an aerobic warm-up, perform two 20-minute pieces at threshold with a short recovery to maintain quality on the second interval.
coaching_points: Conserve a small reserve in the first interval to maintain pace in the second.
Focus on steady splits rather than surges; threshold is about sustainment.
Use the brief recovery to flush legs and reset your mindset.
When fatigue appears, shorten mental targets (e.g., 4x5') to hold intensity.
pacing_guidance: Hold AT split/power throughout both 20' pieces. Keep stroke rate in the 20–24 spm range. Aim for even pacing; limit variance to ±2–3% between and within pieces. Use the recovery to lower HR slightly but avoid cooling the legs too much.

name: 90' Steady UT1 - Max Time at High Aerobic
description: 90 minutes UT1 for experienced athletes to sustain high aerobic load with strict technique control; include 6 x 1' technique checks.
technique_focus: sustaining technique under high aerobic stress
coaching_points: Only advanced athletes should attempt full 90' UT1
Use micro-checks to maintain form
Fuel and hydrate proactively throughout
pacing_guidance: Hold UT1 pace ~2:10/500 for most of session with micro-technique checks to prevent drift towards anaerobic. Monitor lactate sensations and HR closely.

name: 50' Steady UT1 - Sustainable Threshold Edge
description: 50 minutes UT1 with conscious work near the high end of aerobic zone while keeping strokes technically sound.
coaching_points: Monitor HR to avoid crossing threshold
Shorten catch if technique starts to degrade
Keep shoulders relaxed
pacing_guidance: Target upper UT1 ~2:08-2:10/500. Stay technical and back off slightly if lactate sensations appear.

name: 40' Steady UT2 - 4 x 10' Negative Steps
description: 40 minutes composed of 4 x 10' blocks where each subsequent block is slightly faster than the previous to practice controlled negative stepping.
coaching_points: Each 10' should feel progressively harder but still aerobic
Maintain smooth catch and finish
Avoid jerky SR changes
pacing_guidance: Blocks roughly 2:24, 2:20, 2:16, 2:12 per 500m respectively. Keep HR in UT2 band; last block may enter upper UT2.
